naniar
  • Reference
  • Getting Started
  • Gallery
  • Replace with NA
  • News

Replace all values with NA where a certain condition is met

This function takes a dataframe and replaces all values that meet the condition specified as an NA value, following a special syntax.

replace_with_na_all(data, condition)

Arguments

data

A dataframe
condition

A condition required to be TRUE to set NA. Here, the condition is specified with a formula, following the syntax: ~.x {condition}. For example, writing ~.x < 20 would mean "where a variable value is less than 20, replace with NA".

Examples

dat_ms <- tibble::tribble(~x,  ~y,    ~z,
                          1,   "A",   -100,
                          3,   "N/A", -99,
                          NA,  NA,    -98,
                          -99, "E",   -101,
                          -98, "F",   -1)

dat_ms
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>        x y           z
#>    <dbl> <chr>   <dbl>
#> 1   1.00 A     -100   
#> 2   3.00 N/A   - 99.0 
#> 3  NA    <NA>  - 98.0 
#> 4 -99.0  E     -101   
#> 5 -98.0  F     -  1.00
#replace all instances of -99 with NA
replace_with_na_all(data = dat_ms,
                    condition = ~.x == -99)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>        x y           z
#>    <dbl> <chr>   <dbl>
#> 1   1.00 A     -100   
#> 2   3.00 N/A     NA   
#> 3  NA    <NA>  - 98.0 
#> 4  NA    E     -101   
#> 5 -98.0  F     -  1.00

# replace all instances of -98 with NA
replace_with_na_all(data = dat_ms,
                    condition = ~.x == -98)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>        x y           z
#>    <dbl> <chr>   <dbl>
#> 1   1.00 A     -100   
#> 2   3.00 N/A   - 99.0 
#> 3  NA    <NA>    NA   
#> 4 -99.0  E     -101   
#> 5  NA    F     -  1.00

# replace all instances of -99 or -98 with NA
replace_with_na_all(dat_ms,
                    condition = ~.x %in% c(-99, -98))
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>       x y           z
#>   <dbl> <chr>   <dbl>
#> 1  1.00 A     -100   
#> 2  3.00 N/A     NA   
#> 3 NA    <NA>    NA   
#> 4 NA    E     -101   
#> 5 NA    F     -  1.00

# replace all instances of -99 or -98, or "N/A" with NA
replace_with_na_all(dat_ms,
                    condition = ~.x %in% c(-99, -98, "N/A"))
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>       x y           z
#>   <dbl> <chr>   <dbl>
#> 1  1.00 A     -100   
#> 2  3.00 <NA>    NA   
#> 3 NA    <NA>    NA   
#> 4 NA    E     -101   
#> 5 NA    F     -  1.00

# where works with functions
replace_with_na_all(airquality, ~ sqrt(.x) < 5)
#> # A tibble: 153 x 6
#>    Ozone Solar.R Wind   Temp Month   Day
#>    <int>   <int> <lgl> <int> <lgl> <int>
#>  1    41     190 NA       67 NA       NA
#>  2    36     118 NA       72 NA       NA
#>  3    NA     149 NA       74 NA       NA
#>  4    NA     313 NA       62 NA       NA
#>  5    NA      NA NA       56 NA       NA
#>  6    28      NA NA       66 NA       NA
#>  7    NA     299 NA       65 NA       NA
#>  8    NA      99 NA       59 NA       NA
#>  9    NA      NA NA       61 NA       NA
#> 10    NA     194 NA       69 NA       NA
#> # ... with 143 more rows
